intro: Lithospermum obtusum, commonly known as bluntleaf lithospermum, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its roots contain compounds with potential medicinal properties, including antifungal and antibacterial agents. Lithospermum obtusum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
